{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child presents with fever, abdominal distension, and vomiting, which are symptoms of a possible infection. The presence of pus cells in the urine and a high neutrophil count in the WBC count further suggest a urinary tract infection. Waiting for culture results before starting treatment could allow the infection to worsen, so it would be best to start antibiotics immediately. Chloroquine is an antimalarial drug and would not be appropriate in this case. Radio nucleotide studies are not typically used in the initial management of a suspected urinary tract infection.", "answer_choice": "B"}
